website_summaries.verdict: The far-and-away favorite. Reviewers have hiked across the Appalachian trail, the Rockies, Europe, and Asia wearing them.
pros: Amazingly light and cushioned, causing no blisters
Intended for fast hiking over moderate to technical terrain in wet weather
GORE-TEX Performance Comfort Footwear technology offers breathable, waterproof protection
Water-resistant mesh and synthetic upper materials.Gusseted tongue helps keep out debris
Protective rubber toe cap and mud guard
cons: Hook eyelets can catch on things
May run large, so consider this when sizing

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: True to size. I'm a size 7.5 and I bought a 7.5 rather than sizing up which is often suggested with hiking/running shoes. Used with a silk sock liner and Smartwool PhD Outdoor Merino Wool Size Med. Right out of the box I did a 10 mile 3,000 foot elevation gain hike on established dirt/rock trails. Boots were very comfortable all day. Excellent grip. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes for these boots.
customer_reviews.text: I should have stuck with my Targhee II Keen hiking boots. I decided to buy the Salomon X Ultra because I needed a good hiking boot with more cushion for my long hikes. I read some great reviews for the Salomon X Ultra and decided to buy them. Pros: Ultra comfortable, lightweight and definitely waterproof. Con: Has absolutely no traction! I wore them on a short loop-hike to test them out on Camels Hump, VT. I was slipping on dry granite slab, nevermind the wet sections. I wiped out a number of times on terrain my Keens would have gripped easily. I really wanted to give these a good review. Back to hiking in my Keens.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta M. Dell Anno

customer_reviews.title: I researched this shoe for hiking, unfortunately it is ...
customer_reviews.text: I researched this shoe for hiking, unfortunately it is very large for the marked size. I am normally a 7 or 7.5, and read this shoe runs big, so I ordered a 7. I'm not sure if a 6 would fit or if it would be too big still. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Little Mel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking shoe, totally waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hiking boots to take with me to a trip to Alaska where I would be hiking in wet conditions. These shoes do not disappoint! The ankle support on these shoes is great and something that I was looking for with the knowledge that I would be hiking in rugged terrain. I tested out the waterproof durability of these shoes and they held up. I walked through puddles and stood in ice-cold streams up to my ankles and didn't have a single drop on my socks. I also wear them hiking trails in Florida and the ankle support (again) is key. I'm very pleased with these shoes and would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea K.

customer_reviews.title: very last minute and I pretty much went on my best friends hiking shoe pick
customer_reviews.text: This was a complicated buy, very last minute and I pretty much went on my best friends hiking shoe pick. I basically broke them in while on the Camino de Santiago adventure in Europe! They worked well not that heavy, pretty water proof good foot support, got only one little blister...Think is was combination cotton socks and bit of imbalance issues. But will be using them for every walk from now until they fall apart. I don't' think they will be falling apart anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Elsie

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend for ankle support and water resistance
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for beginners or for a round hiking shoe. They have great traction, ankle protection, and comfort. The first time I wore these, my dog pulled me into a river, almost above the ankle at the top of the shoe and my feet still did not get wet! They are so comfortable that the second time I wore them, I decided to take them on a fourteener and they were so very comfortable. I have had tennis shoes that require more breaking in. They have saved me from twisting my ankle or sliding down the mountain many times. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Some Pros, Some Cons
customer_reviews.text: When I originally tried these on, it was like walking on air. The arch support is dreamy. But after wearing these hiking every week, the chafing around my ankles has become unbearable. I think wearing high top hiking boots is not the way to go. I wouldn't recommend high top hiking boots to my worst enemy, unless you like the feeling of having constricted ankles. On the plus side, however, these are waterproof in both puddles, crossing streams, and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best hiking shoes around. They do run a little big. I wear a 7 and probably should have gotten a 6.5 ( I kept the 7 because of heavy socks) I wore these new on a 26 (rt) with a 5000 ft gain in elevation. I only mention this because of all the climbing we had to do these boots did not give my any problems. We have to hike though streams, snow , granite, dirt had to jump over fallen trees and I had no blisters. These are some of the best shoes I own, I would highly recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn P.

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots. I normally wear a size 7 and tried on a pair at EMS, but I found them just a little snug and they didn't have a 7 1/2. I ended up buying the boot through the internet in 7 1/2 and it fits well with a medium heavy sock that I'll be wearing during a long hike I'll be taking soon. So far I've only worn them a few hours but I trust they will take care of me. They are high quality, light weight yet rugged enough for all sorts of terrain and quite comfortable right out of the box..
customer_reviews.author: FastLikeJudy

customer_reviews.title: Come untied several times.
customer_reviews.text: I like these boots...however the strings/laces won't stay tied.... when I contacted Salomon they told me to go to a store and have a chat with the salesperson there to obtain laces that would not come untied. That is a sad way of doing business. I had to retie them three times during a 3 hour hike and same thing again on another hike. I will not purchase Salomon again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy Salomon worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong buying Salomon shoes. These are to replace a pair I bought in 2002. They have been worn all these years and show very litttle wear on the soles. I will pass these on at a thrift store with a not saying these shoes were loved. I bought the new ones because I see a little wear on rubber the toe area and because now retired I wear them more than ever. I got a hot pink to replace the blue time I had. Delivery was on time and was packed well. I have not worn yet because snow on ground and I am waiting for a nice spring day to be my 1st wearing.
customer_reviews.author: jef

customer_reviews.title: Seriously THE best!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these AMAZING boots for almost a year now and they are my all time favorite. I have hiked Mt. Washington in the snow and Shenandoah in the summer and these boots have kept my feet feeling great no matter the weather. They required no break in time and are always clean. I know this sounds weird, but I have walked through mud, water, snow and dirt, never have I cleaned them yet they always look brand new. I cannot stress enough how awesome these boots are. Do yourself a favor and buy them, you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn Childress

customer_reviews.title: truly waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I've used these boots for a full year in rain and snow and they have been great. sturdy, true to size, and truly waterproof. If you submerge your foot you can feel the boot go cold, but it stays dry. great for longer spring, fall, and winter hiking. A little too hot for summer hikes.
customer_reviews.author: KCassey

customer_reviews.title: Not what I Expected
customer_reviews.text: My first couple of hikes with these were used on trails that were fairly smooth and of short duration, 8 miles each hike. But then I did a strenuous, steep hike on the Rocky Top trail in the Great Smoky Mountains. This is a 12 mile hike, very steep and a rocky trail. About half way in both my feet were getting hot spots. I was in agony by the time I got off the trail. I so wished I could have returned them but the allotted time had expired. If you hike long distances, rocky terrain and strenuous hikes I would not recommend these. They definitely need more padding in the front of the boot!
customer_reviews.author: FlyinMare

customer_reviews.title: No Breaking in Needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I was going out to Yosemite for a girls trip, and realized my hiking shoes weren't going to last through that trip. With no time to break them in, I was worried but these worked out great. I hiked about 9ish miles (with steep ascent and descent) without issue. My ankles were a little tender, just because I needed to wrap my laces around for tightness but will be lacing a new way moving foward. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: High quality, comfortable, supportive, good for icy snowy conditions
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for winter walking around town. I have very picky feet that generally only tolerate birkenstocks. When I put these on I don't feel a massive amount of arch support but it must be there because I can walk miles per day in these and my feet feel great. They are heavy duty enough to handle walking around in inches of snow and on ice, but still sneaker-ish enough to wear comfortably all day if you can't change into other shoes. After one winter/spring of wearing daily they show almost no wear, I expect them to last well.
customer_reviews.author: yacon

customer_reviews.title: Get half size down
customer_reviews.text: Get half size down. I'm 8.5 on running shoes and order 8. They fit perfected. See the picture right side my 8.5 ASICS compared to 8 Solomon
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable right out of the box. Plenty of toe room and cushion.
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! I bought these to take on a hiking tour in New Zealand and got them several months early so I could wear them in. I could have bought them the day before the trip and been perfectly happy. They are so comfortable! I have size 10 feet, average width, high arch. I ordered a size 10 and have the perfect amount of wiggle room without sliding around in the boot. As far as comfort, these are the perfect boots for me. I haven’t had them long enough to weigh in on durability and longevity but would absolutely buy them again for comfort alone.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my wife. We needed some new hiking shoes for her. We had merrel before but this time chose to go with these after reading the reviews. We went on a hike in Lone pine CA and she loved these. She said they were super comfy and had great support. I would def suggest these for other women. I will buy a pair of these now for men. sorry this is an addition to my first post. My wife is returning these because she said they were too big even with some thicker hiking socks. We will be buying a size 7 M for womens. still a great hiking shoe
customer_reviews.author: chaddy

customer_reviews.title: The traction is very good. I walked through densely covered forests
customer_reviews.text: I walked miles and miles all around a trip to Japan and Italy. These boots withstood rain, snow and sleet. The traction is very good. I walked through densely covered forests, streams, steep hills, and volcanic rocks. These boot are amazing. I have no rips, tears, or scratches. The gortex toe box does wonders. My feet were never wet or cold. I can't wait to see how much more I can get out off these boots. I've had them for 2 months and they've been put to the test. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a sturdy boot and I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs alittle more though on upper ankle part with shower lace
customer_reviews.text: The top around the upper ankle keeps becoming lose and I keep having to stop to retie them. It' sucks when trying to take pictures and most of my time is spent Re-laceing the laces. I have to save up more money to possibly get a new pair of boots. which I hate to do when I have these books. guess my hiking trip will just have to wait another season (1 full year now). no way to save money with in a week and have them delivered in him for next weekend.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: High quality, lightweight, all purpose trekking boot!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to all the other reviews that helped me choose these boots. I did order 1/2 size larger and they fit just right. They do provide great ankle support, are lightweight and seem very well made. I am very happy with the graphite/pink color choice. They could have a bit more arch support, but that is easily fixed with orthotics. I have plenty of toe room and do not experience heel slippage with sufficient tightening of the laces. I purchased these for three weeks trekking in China. I wanted a cross between a trail shoe and a boot, and these fit that combo. Will report back once I have used them more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic hiking boot.. Dry feet are happy feet
customer_reviews.text: Highly highly recommend these hiking boots. I wore them right out of the box on a 6 mile hike in loose gravel, water covered trial and uneven terrain. My ankles were completely supported, my steps through running water through the run off was solid and my feet stayed dry. I have orthotics for over printing and they fit great. I am buying these in another color and the price is fantastic! Ladies these beat Merrils and keen for comfort and stability in my small opinion. I hike year around and happy I found a good boot
customer_reviews.author: meshl

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, run large, and cause blisters
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The toe is reinforced and the colors are awesome. Cons: I ordered a full size smaller than my normal hiking boot side based on the reviews, and the boots are still too loose. On two separate backpacking trips, I got horrible blisters on my heels and toes- even with wool socks and sock liners, stopping to take care of my feet ever 2-3 miles with powder, and adding mole skin as soon as I felt a hot spot. I have a long history of backpacking, and have never had issues with blisters prior to wearing this boot. They also are not very water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: AshTreeHugger

customer_reviews.title: nice but
customer_reviews.text: right out of the box the fit is good. I wear a 7.5 normally but have a bit of wiggle room which is causing heel rub and blisters. I doubt buying a half size smaller would have been better. I'm going to put a heel foam into the shoe and try that. Other than that these shoes are comfy right out of the box. The height is good too keeping debris out while on hikes.
customer_reviews.author: candy

customer_reviews.title: These are really comfortable, and have excellent traction
customer_reviews.text: Did a five day hike in these boots with no break in time. For all of the straight up and down (full day of each) my feet faired very well. These are really comfortable, and have excellent traction. We got rained on for 6 hours straight one day, and they did get soaked, but dried reasonably quickly when set in front of the fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had great plans of doing smaller hikes to break them in
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a 10 mile hike on the Inka trail. I had great plans of doing smaller hikes to break them in, but that did not quite work out the way I had planned. I wore them around my office for 1 day and that was it prior to the long hike, so I was anticipating blisters etc, the usual. THESE BOOTS ARE GREAT! Pretty lightweight, no blisters (worn with hiking socks), and I am VERY clumsy, these definitely saved my ankles more than once on that hike. I would highly recommend these boots!
customer_reviews.author: JSF

customer_reviews.title: Runs large, excellent grip
customer_reviews.text: Hello women hikers, I love this boot! My previous boot was a Salomon and I cried when I could no longer wear it...I wore the treads off after seven years. I hike Mt Tom Reservation in W Massachusetts 2-3 times a week. I knew from previous reviews that this boot runs big, so I bought it in 8.5 & 9. Yup, it runs big! But I just load on thicker socks to fill out the space. These boots are used for 3 seasons, not winter, so I can't report on how they work in that season. Descent grip on slippery rocks, nice looking boots to boot! Happy Hiking!
customer_reviews.author: 4 Bright Eyes

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the product seems to be really good, amazingly light
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the product seems to be really good, amazingly light, and pretty. However, the width does not fit my feet. Too bad it does not work for me. My co worker loved it and she recommended to buy this one when I was going to order different brand. I wish they make wider shoes. I have to return it as it is too tight and I would not be able to walk long hours in it. My feedback is nuetral for that reason, not because of the quality of the shoes. The shoes will be like a wing if it fit for me for the weight of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: These hiking boots are some of the most comfortable shoes I own
customer_reviews.text: These hiking boots are some of the most comfortable shoes I own. They are well cushioned on the inside. They also do an excellent job of protecting my ankles, and have prevented me from twisting them multiple times on rocky terrain. They are water proof, and have served me well on many hiking adventures. I can also say, my feet are never hurting after a long hike. I have never had any issues with blisters while wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and Great traction!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I enjoy hiking, but I needed better support and more traction than tennis shoes! I bought these in the high tops, but they really hurt around my ankles and were too high for me. So, I purchase these and I love them! They have excellent arch support, are true to size, comfortable, and have excellent traction. We've gone on several hikes now and I've worn them in the water as well. They dry out nicely and do not get stiff like other hiking boots I've had. Love these hiking boots!
customer_reviews.author: Annie H

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough positive things about these boots. My first pair lasted me about 1400 miles on the Appalachian Trail. My second pair finished the trail and are still going strong. Obviously water can get in from the top but other than that they were very water resistant. After prolonged exposure (12 hours or so) to water my feet did get wet but that was few and far between. I love these boots and doubt I will buy boots outside of the Salomon family again.
customer_reviews.author: Inch

customer_reviews.title: I’m very pleased with a great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this boot. I had on two pair of merino wool socks and they were still comfortable. They’re warm, the traction is good and they’re cute and comfortable. My daughter will usually compliment me by saying “they’re cute for you” but this time she said she wanted a pair. I got compliments from other family members and co workers but besides that I love the functionality of the boot. The only con is they wouldn’t stay tied. I had to make a double knot. Just a small inconvenience but I would definitely buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mountain Hiking
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I wore them on my first hike ever this weekend. I did 2 trails for a total of about 6 miles. I had absolutely no issues with tred or water. They fit perfect, even with thick hiking socks. I really appreciated the reinforced ankle support as walking over rocks can make your foot slide. I HIGHLY recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Southerntwangqt

customer_reviews.title: If you want boots for hiking.... look no further
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about these boots. I purchased them for an 11 day trek heavy on the hiking, and figured I'd wear them around my local trails to get them broken in.... I honestly don't think I need to break them in. I hiked over 5 miles in them on my first day and no fatigue except from literally walking 5 miles. 11/10 recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Nicki England

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rate these boots high enough. Bought them here instead of a local outdoor shop for much cheaper. The boots arrived and 5 days later went on a pretty significant hiking week long trip. Not ideal as I like to break my shoes in but I reinjured my ankle and needed something with more support. These boots went many miles in many different conditions and are amazing. Cannot express how happy I am.
customer_reviews.author: scureton

customer_reviews.title: It fits to the size. I wear size 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: It fits to the size. I wear size 6 for my normal shoes. for hiking, I usually order 0.5 to 1 size larger, however in this case it would be very large (as I tired and returned!). So the normal shoes sizes is fits on this shoe perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: coffee7

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this shoe!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had read the reviews so knew to order my exact size and they fit perfectly with thick socks. Very lightweight and lots of support. Most comfortable shoes ever on my feet!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Sloane

customer_reviews.title: Run Very large, Very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These run very large. They are hard, and painful to wear. I only wore them in the house for about an hour, to try them out. I even tried wearing them with two extra thick pair of socks, but it didn't help. Unfortunately, due to illness, I missed the window to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Multi purpose comfortable trekkers
customer_reviews.text: These are the best shoes I ever had. I am a farmer and don’t always want to wear boots. So these are great traction pretty water resistant very stable for climbing on rocks or slippery surfaces. They are also extremely comfortable. My only complaint is I would like to see some kind of gator offered with the shoe because it is open that up enough to scoop in a lot of weed seeds etc.
customer_reviews.author: Misha Nogha

customer_reviews.title: Really good, no break-in period shoes
customer_reviews.text: Walked 20 miles in these the first time I got them, and my feet didn't hurt. Nice ankle support. My toes did get blisters but that's my fault, I should've worn better socks. In less than a month, these shoes already have over 60 miles in them. Hoping they'll last me at least a couple of years, since I go through shoes real fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine DLR

customer_reviews.title: Great fit right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hiking boots to wear while hiking Mt. Washington. I did not have time to break them in and though other reviews stated they were great right away I was still nervous. They ended up being very comfortable!! No blisters and I had them on for 9 hours. Great fit, nice looking, and very supportive. I ended up getting my normal size 7 and the fit was perfect. My last pair of Solomon hiking sneakers were a 7.5, so I guess these do run slightly large as far as hiking boots go. I did walk through some water but not enough to really be able to speak for how waterproof they are. I highly recommend these boots!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I love the boot now that I finally have the right size. I ordered my normal size 9 and when they arrived I wore them around the house and then on an 8-mile hike. I did not get any blisters or hot spots and they were comfortable enough but I felt I had too much room in the boot so I ordered a size 8 1/2 and they are perfect. I kept the size 9 because I think I can wear them with a thicker sock. Overall I think it's an excellent boot.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable hiking boot I've found.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing them in around the house in preparation for some major hiking coming up. I had heard form others hat these were their favorite hiking boots and wanted to try them for myself. They are super comfortable and the arch support was noticeable. I have high arches and often find the top of my foot gets too much pressure in boots and laced shoes. I haven't had a problem with these so far. So far I'm very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: lady_cupcake

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: Love this hiking shoe. I purchased these for a snow hike. I am usually always cold. I wore thin wool socks with them on the first hike. The boots were warm and comfortable. No blisters or sore spots on first hike or any time after. Very comfy. The tread is good for gripping. I have hiked in them over ten times already. The fit is great. They are the most comfortable hike shoe I have. I love the color. I bought pink yankz for them (but I have not put them in yet). Highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a 1/2 size smaller and they are perfect. I usually wear an 8
customer_reviews.text: Following previous reviewer's advice, I ordered a 1/2 size smaller and they are perfect. I usually wear an 8, ordered 7 1/2. Plenty of room for cushioned socks and my toes don't rub against the front when going down hill. So far, these are very comfortable. I love how light they are yet provide solid footing over various surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: robi810

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for comfortable hiking boots but these have become my all day every day boot as well as hiking boot. I am a bit overweight and often have trouble with my feet hurting. They are so comfortable my feet never hurt.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: I have taken these through jungles, back country hikes and through rivers. These are excellent! If they ever come apart (remember I do a LOT of hiking in 5 class hikes ), then I would DEFINITELY buy them again and again! Never once had a problem with blisters either.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The boots arrived yesterday and I immediately put them on. Fit perfectly and felt like a dream. Walked around the house for a few hours. Today I took them on a 7mile hike. I am still smiling. No hot spots, my 75 year old feet (hammer toes and bunions) felt good from start to finish. Love how light they are. God willing they will take me 490 miles across the Camino de Santiago in September.
customer_reviews.author: Shady Lane

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go hiking in Scotland. No need to break them in beforehand. Comfortable and kept my feet dry in the rain and mud. Fit as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: These were very comfortable and waterproof for sure
customer_reviews.text: These were very comfortable and waterproof for sure! I used them in Iceland and didn't need to break them in. They didn't give me any blisters and were warm. Definitely recommend. Pretty light weight too.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: light-weight, great hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I used to own Vasquez hiking shoes and after 10 years decided it's probably time to get new hiking shoes. These shoes are so light weight compared to my old ones. great traction.
customer_reviews.author: Joanneatamazon

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Used them on very strenuous 3day hike for the first time. Very comfortable and great grip. Still in good shape 2 years later (light use, maybe every 4-6 months).
customer_reviews.author: S. B.

customer_reviews.title: Good, Comfortable, Light Hiking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good hiking boot that would support my ankle as I carry my toddler in our hiking backpack. I already had a pair of Salomon trail running shoes that I had been using but was really looking for a bit more support overall. To date I have only taken them snowshoeing so can't give the full review on how they work with the hiking backpack but so far so good! Love Salomon shoes, really comfortable right out of the box. Bought my husband a pair as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Holly

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are so well cushioned and comfortable that I didn't really need to break them in. Took them on a three week trek in the Himalayas and can't be happier with the performance. Tough, warm, breathable, great traction, and after I cleaned it post trek, the soles looked almost new. The trail was often broken rocks and loose scree and I expected a bit of wear and tear, but the boots held up wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Aiamu

customer_reviews.title: Initially quite pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used for walks a couple of times. Wanting to make sure I get broke in without problems. Slight uncomfortable spot on right upper foot last night, re-laced, but was still there. I don't think is serious and will go away. My daughter picked these out. We are going to go on a 100 mile camino walk in Spain this summer. All three of us have gotten the same pair. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These hiking boots are very comfortable. The insole kept my feet from pain even ...
customer_reviews.text: These hiking boots are very comfortable. The insole kept my feet from pain even when having walked in them for 8 hour a day. There was little break in period and and little rubbing. The ankle support is decent and I like the angle cut above the ankle because I think it makes going downhill a bit easier. One minor issue is that the shoe is a little big large around the ankle so it's hard to tighten to a perfect fit. I still like them a lot and hope that I can get a lot of use out of them before they fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Was able to walk miles in these shoes in heavy clay mud and thick leaves in November. They were really comfortable and easy to clean. Even though it had rained prior and the ground was wet my feet stayed clean and dry.
customer_reviews.author: malisnear

customer_reviews.title: Is definitely recommend trying shoes on in store with a sales clerk ...
customer_reviews.text: I have never both hiking boots but I wanted a pair for a trip to Iceland. I'd definitely recommend trying shoes on in store with a sales clerk who knows what you should be looking for. These fit really well for me, well fit with enough space in the toes to prevent bruising when climbing over rocks. This was the best investment for the Iceland trip, I was able to wear it right out of the box with no problems with hiking on rocks, sands, cobblestones and other terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! Super comfortable right out of the box. I had just gone on a mountain hike with my old boots and wasn't looking forward to any breaking in the next day. My feet went "ahhh....."! No blisters, no problems. Took them up to almost 13,000 feet, hiked for several hours in snowy and muddy conditions, feet were dry and happy! I'm already recommending them to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have not had extensive test of the shoes yet. I have tried them on with heavy socks and they are fine. Salomon shoes are definitely narrower than my old Keen's, but Keen's sole is very poor in traction and becomes slippery on any surface quickly. The color of this Salomon pair is somewhat dull, perhaps good for getting dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Way Why

customer_reviews.title: These fit so much better than the Salomon snow boot
customer_reviews.text: These fit so much better than the Salomon snow boot! There's even extra room in the toe area, which you want for a hiking shoe. I have a wide foot and these feel comfortable. I haven't given them a try in snow yet, so I can't speak to how waterproof or warm they are, but I have space for warm, cushioned socks and I'm not too concerned. I also love how much lighter they are compared to my old Salomon hiking boot!
customer_reviews.author: FLietz

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and plenty of room for socks at a 7.5 size foot.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried them on a trail or slushy conditions yet , but they are comfortable when I've put them on and there's plenty of room for a pair of smart-wool socks. I imagine the Gore-Tex will keep my feet plenty warm when it's cold outside. The bottom is a bit stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Mtrio

customer_reviews.title: they held up great and my feet were somewhat cold but dry (it ...
customer_reviews.text: The first time I wore these boots I ended up in the depths of the wilderness for 8 hours (long story), and also had to trek through a shallow river... they held up great and my feet were somewhat cold but dry (it was about 35 degrees). They are somewhat heavy, but they were very comfortable and did not give me blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: They are fantastic! Didn’t even need to brake them in
customer_reviews.text: I just came back from a month long trip to Ireland and Kenya. I used the boots every single day. They are fantastic! Didn’t even need to brake them in. They are very comfortable, water proof works great. Also not too warm. It was hot in Africa but my feet didn’t sweat horribly with these. I really recommend them. Colors are just like the picture!
customer_reviews.author: Fabs

customer_reviews.title: These are the best hiking shoes you will every find!
customer_reviews.text: Just retuned from Chile! Hiked in all terrains, dessert sand, gravel, red clay up and downs, dry, wet... you name it! I loved these shoes! Wore these shoes daily for 12 days. Any moisture dried quickly! No slipping, great traction climbing and descending steep and wet terrain. Highly recommend these shoes! Bought a size 8. Depending on the shoe I can wear 8-8.5. I bought well in advance of this trip for time to exchange (but did not need to) and time to break in. These shoe were very comfortable from the start!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Buy buy!
customer_reviews.text: Buy 1/2 bigger than u wear! Save your toe nails or 1 whole size your choice! Totally worth it! Luv luv these boots first time hiker.
customer_reviews.author: TRISH RECORDS

customer_reviews.title: Great hikers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my mom as a gift. She walks 4-6 miles almost everyday with about half of that distance being on the trail. These are her first pair of dedicated hiking boots and she absolutely loves them. I would definitely buy these again. The boots are too new at this point to determine their durability, but I expect them to last a long time just for day hikes (no backpack or extra weight).
customer_reviews.author: Tigerfan34

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet dry in appalachain trails.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit great on me considering I'm super flat footed. It has a very good grip on wet rocks when we were hiking by small waterfalls along our trail. And it is always a plus if your feet are dry after the long rewarding hikes. I also used these pair on snowy trails. I would definitely recommend these shoes :)
customer_reviews.author: S. Farmer

customer_reviews.title: I usually wear a 6. 5 or 7 but ...
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear a 6.5 or 7 but had tried them on in the store before purchasing them on Amazon and ordered a 6. First weekend of having them, I walked 9.5 miles, 7.5 miles and 6.5 miles in three days with absolutely no complaints. They rock!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Fry

customer_reviews.title: They seem to be a good quality but I miss the all leather Solomon's I ...
customer_reviews.text: We had to return them because they were too big. They seem to be a good quality but I miss the all leather Solomon's I think they were called "X Mountain". I finally bit the bullet spend some extra money and went with a Limmer boot.
customer_reviews.author: Harold J.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and waterproof. Wore these on hikes in Peru; they held up great and needed no break in time.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Sznakowski

customer_reviews.title: Great support!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a 9 half size up from my actual size. They have been perfect for long hikes. A little stiff compared to another brand I wear but has excellent support. Is totally waterproof. Very comfortable on long hikes (7 miles). Light!
customer_reviews.author: gizmogal

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sturdy, comfortable, durable
customer_reviews.text: I love these and use them in the late Fall, Winter and early Spring months when I go hiking in various terrains. They protect my ankles which are somewhat weak...and they feel secure, and comfortable without being too bulky. I have narrow feet, and these fit me well, I usually wear hiking socks. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cassy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes. Can't wait to get some more use ...
customer_reviews.text: I generally wear a 9 but after trying them on around the house they didn't feel snug enough around the foot. I ordered an 8.5 to compare and ended up keeping the 8.5 because they felt more snug around the foot but the toe box still had enough room. Comfortable shoes. Can't wait to get some more use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Sam's sister

customer_reviews.title: Love my Salomons!
customer_reviews.text: Salomon does it again! I just received these and wore them on a 2-mile walk right away, some up & downhill but nothing crazy. They're comfortable, supportive, no rubbing against any part of my foot or blistering. Will wear them on some longer hikes before heading up to Cloud's Rest next month! Maybe Mount Tallac? This is my 3rd pair of Salomon shoes but the first high-top, figured the upcoming hikes might require more ankle support. I've been extremely happy with Salomon!
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla C.

customer_reviews.title: Like the boot but not the blisters
customer_reviews.text: Like most other hiking boot brands I wear a 7.5 despite that I'm usually more of an 8 in other shoes. These are great at keeping feet warmer and dry but do breath. My only issue is that they seem to cause blisters for me more than my other hiking boots, especially on the downhill. I spent months breaking them in but still have issues. Otherwise a great boot.
customer_reviews.author: Slick_Nic

customer_reviews.title: Returned These
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. While lightweight and distinctively styled, they felt as if the last was for a very generic foot type and not fitted through the arch or with lacing that holds the heel down snuggly enough. You might like them if you want a high top trail sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Loves3Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe! Love the extra room in the toe box that still allows the rest of the shoe to fit snugly. Due to a previous injury I have poor circulation in my feet so they are always cold, even go numb frequently. But this shoe keeps my feet nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: angela xhakolli

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, feel wonderful, good grip, durable, waterproof, comfortable for all day hiking.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pangal

customer_reviews.title: Great Treking Boot
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these boots for years for hiking. They are awesome. I keep replacing them with the same model. These last ones I didn't even have to break in. Love them for day hikes. We like to do 10-20 mile day hikes. I have been buying Salomons for 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: Monica S Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: These boots are a little tight in the ankles but that’s typical with a mid-rise boot. I just leave them a little lose and they’re comfortable. I haven’t tried to put in my orthotics but my feet don’t hurt after a full day of wearing them. They are narrow and have good support in the arches so I may not need the orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie K

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Got a great deal on these boots! Weird that they're so much wider than Salomon Women's X-Mission 3 W Trail Running Shoe, which I also bought in the same size. I took out the stock insoles, replaced with Superfeet Green here on Amazon, and picked up a set of four People Socks (also on Amazon). Now everything fits as it should. :)
customer_reviews.author: Joan H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for warm weather hiking.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Hawaii and can't recommend these boots enough for warm weather and muddy trails! They are light, waterproof, NOT HOT, have excellent traction, and are very, very comfortable out of the box. I wear size 10 in athletic shoes and these fit with some room for the toes. I am glad I didn't go a half size up (or down) as some, definitely mixed, reviews suggested.
customer_reviews.author: TmK

customer_reviews.title: Just buy these
customer_reviews.text: HOLY HELL I LOVE THESE BOOTS! They make me want to hike everyday. Instantly comfortable as soon as I put them on, and they keep my feet nice and dry in the slush. If you have the money, they're definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: because the material of the upper parts of the boot looks like mesh and doesn't seem very strong
customer_reviews.text: They seem to fit perfectly and they are really light. I've been using them almost everyday in the mountains during a year and they are still like new. I had doubts about its durability but they seem to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Davinia Beneyto Garrigós

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Took them backpacking for a few days and they were very comfortable the entire time. Excellent waterproof. A little slippery on wet rocks but liked them other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Alecia Jensen

customer_reviews.title: An excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot. No break-in time. Took off hiking from day 1 and no issues with blisters etc. My only suggestion is if you are in between sizes that you order the size down. I wear a 9 in some shoes, so ordered that size. Was too big so returned for 8 1/2, perfect fit. Walked through creeks and mud with no leaking so far. Light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Oster

customer_reviews.title: ... conditions and terrains for several weeks and they worked great. My husband I both got similar Solomon hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: Just hiked in all sorts of conditions and terrains for several weeks and they worked great. My husband I both got similar Solomon hiking boots and LOVED them. We felt great support on both steep downhill and uphill. Super happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Blazin

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfortable shoes, but they have a terrible squeak in them!
customer_reviews.text: I own these shoes in another color, so was super excited to get the. In this color. Unfortunately, after only a couple wears, the shoes have a very noticeable squeak, as though the foot beds are coming unglued or something. Annoying & makes them unable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: peastin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes
customer_reviews.text: They are very comfortable and fit perfect!! Love the fact that I can walk in the snow and get my socks wet because they are waterproof!!! Some shoes I have had in the past said they were waterproof but obviously were not. Awesome shoes I love every pair of Solomons I own. :)
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Runs big! Great boot.
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I normally wear a size 9/9.5 (normally 9.5) and originally ordered these in a size 9 but then returned for a size 8.5. They definitely run a little big and I would rather them be somewhat tight for hiking because they will stretch out and you don't want your foot sliding around while hiking. I also tried them on with a pretty thick sock. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: pam ashley

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable these are my second pair
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable these are my second pair. I could not believe I could buy a shoe that was so wearable from the box. No pain,, no discomfort, no "wear in" time. Just perfect. Feels like my foot is wrapped in a glove.
customer_reviews.author: T. Witt

customer_reviews.title: My only disappointment is that the sole is not particularly secure on ...
customer_reviews.text: My only disappointment is that the sole is not particularly secure on ice. I can walk across a nasty, icy parking lot if I'm careful, but if I forget and try to push off too hard with my toes, I have little to no traction. Break out the Yak-Trax!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sibley

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Wore these boots for the first time this weekend and right out of the box they were amazing so I can only imagine they will get better as I wear them in. There was a lot of mud and water on the trail and my feet were warm and dry. I would highly recommend these boots, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Spring Sieber

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I just love these boots! They are very comfortable and grippy for hiking. I sometimes wear an 8 in boots but these fit perfectly in a 7.5 even with thicker hiking socks.
customer_reviews.author: reteayen

customer_reviews.title: These are great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great hiking shoes, I have a little wiggle room in these and I"m not sure if you're supposed to or not? I alwasy wear 9.5 and that's what I ordered. They are great with my thick hiking socks on and they keep my feet dry even when walking through mud puddles. I mostly use them for hiking day trips
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Wright

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a pair a half size smaller than my running shoes and they fit/feel great. By far the most comfortable & lightweight hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 foot surgeries, i was very hesitant to buy these online without being able to try them on first. Reading the reviews about them running a bit large, I purchased a pair a half size smaller than my running shoes and they fit/feel great. By far the most comfortable & lightweight hiking shoe I've ever owned. They'll be put to the test in a few weeks after a 40 mile hike in the mountains....
customer_reviews.author: Denise DeMeyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I've starting hiking in these boots right out of the box in the desert and in the forests of Arizona. They are super comfortable, and have great traction on our rocky terrain. Love them... and thinking of ordering another color!
customer_reviews.author: AZ resident

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hiking
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable in hiking and not for paved walkways. Love them, only wish the shoe laces were a little longer for tying a better knot, they come untied often. Shoe laces can be purshased, so its not a big deal, just a suggestion for the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: wyndi patrie

product_meta.title: Salomon Women's X Ultra Mid 2 GTX Hiking Shoe
product_meta.description: Salomon was born in 1947 in the heart of the French Alps and the birthplace of modern alpinism. Driven by a passion for skiing and design innovation, Francois Salomon and his son George designed and perfected much of the first modern ski equipment. During the following 60 years, Salomon's commitment to innovative design and passion for mountain sports created a vast range of revolutionary new concepts in boots, skis and apparel and brought innovative solutions to footwear, apparel and equipment for hiking, adventure racing, mountaineering and trail running. Through performance-driven design, Salomon enhances mountain sports by converting new ideas into action and expanding the limits of possibility.
feature_bullets: Lace-up hiking shoe with textile lining featuring diagonal logo at side heel and GORE-TEX Performance Comfort membrane for waterproof protection
Sensifit system to cradle foot for precise and secure fit
